thread.title: Birmingham boss Gianfranco Zola under pressure after just two months in St Andrews hot seat
thread.title_full: Birmingham boss Gianfranco Zola under pressure after just two months in St Andrews hot seat

author: Martin Domin
title: Birmingham boss Gianfranco Zola under pressure after just two months in St Andrews hot seat
text:
Birmingham boss Gianfranco Zola under pressure after just two months in St Andrews hot seat The Italian has just one victory from his opening 12 matches after succeeding Gary Rowett Share Gianfranco Zola is struggling at Birmingham (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Gianfranco Zola is coming under increasing pressure from Birmingham City’s owners following his disastrous start as the club’s new boss. 
The Italian has just one victory from his opening 12 matches after succeeding Gary Rowett in the St Andrews hot seat. 
And the Chinese owners have made it known that the five points secured under him is not the return they were anticipating. 
A delegation from the company that owns Brum, Trillion Trophy Asia, was at last Saturday’s game – a rare 1-0 victory against Fulham. 
And a source said: "The manager has been made aware of what the owners expect." 
Friday night’s 3-0 defeat at Sheffield Wednesday also lacked the eastern promise surrounding Zola’s appointment when it was hoped he might catapult the club into the play-offs. Birmingham have won one of Zola's 12 games in charge (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Like us on Facebook
